nodes.bodyText: Use Collections.newSetFromMap(new ConcurrentHashMap<String,Boolean>()) instead. Then we can remove the synchronised in the add and remove methods bellow.

nodes.bodyText: I don't think there's any exception that can happen here?

Maybe it is redundant，If an unknown problem occurs with add and remove, I just want to make sure that it will not affect the normal process.
Or am I thinking a little too much?
Yeah, they're just methods on Set. They can only throw Errors or RuntimeExceptions, and I think we should just let those bubble out if they ever happen.
I agree with @chrisvest here..
Okay, I've adjusted it.
With a Set based on ConcurrentHashMap, we can just iterate it directly. Since we are at JVM shut down at this point, I don't think we need to clear the set.
Ok
Remove comment.
Easier to do the casts at variable declaration site.
What behaviour are we trying to verify?
Okay, I got it.
Remove comment.
Why is the length zero when we set 4 bytes of content?
Throw an exception to test whether the hook will execute properly at the end of the program.
Remove comment. Also, we should verify that the file no longer exists, and that it's pathname is no longer in the set of files to delete on shut down.
We should also have a test that verifies that the registered files are deleted by the shut down hook.
Ok

Tests don't run in any particular order, so this test also needs to do the work to ensure that some file uploads are created. It can then call runHooks directly (since it has package visibility) to simulate the shutdown.
